intro: Hesperis novakii, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by fluffy seed heads. Its botanical features include basal leaves and a taproot system, which help it survive in its native environment.
